intro: Tragopogonodes picrodes, commonly known as the yellow goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and bright yellow ray flowers that resemble a beard. The plant produces a distinctive, hollow, tubular flower head that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it has been introduced to other regions, including North America. Tragopogonodes picrodes typically grows in sunny, open areas such as meadows and along roadsides.
